              }
            },
            "fileName": {
              "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        }
      },
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "applicationModel": {
    "job": 356347,
    "itemsRule": {
      "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/hyper-schema#",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "coverLetter": {
          "type": "object",
          "format": "tas-fileUpload",
          "access": "candidateOwned",
          "options": {
            "accept": "image/png,text/html"
          },
          "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",
          "properties": {
            "data": {
              "type": "string",
              "media": {
                "binaryEncoding": "base64"
              }
            },
            "fileName": {
              "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        },
        "favoriteColor": {
          "type": "string",
          "access": "eeo",
          "title": "Favorite color",
          "description": "Tell us your favorite color. Our advanced hiring algorithm uses it.",
          "default": "blue",
          "minLength": 1
        },
        "letters": {
          "type": "integer",
          "title": "Letters",
          "access": "eeo",
          "description": "How many letters are in this sentence?",
          "minimum": 0,
          "maximum": 20
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "favoriteColor",
        "letters"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  }
}

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /editSpecs/fetches/register/me post

    post

    post /editSpecs/fetches/register/me

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
    "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "tracker": {
            "type": "integer"
        },
        "categories": {
            "$ref": "categoriesActual.json"
        }
    },
    "additionalProperties": false
}

    Example:

    {
       "tracker": 763019932
}

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "candidateMessage": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "message": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "a text message to the candidate regarding their proposed edit, may include links"
        },
        "level": {
          "enum": [
            "info",
            "warning",
            "error"
          ]
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "message",
        "level"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    },
    "resumeRule": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "visible": {
          "description": "can a resume be uploaded at all, and can existing resume be seen",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "mandatory": {
          "description": "is the resume mandatory - implies visible == true",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "message": {
          "description": "a message to help the candidate understand about uploading a resume - e.g. 'resume optional when a video is provided'",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "accept": {
          "type": "array",
          "description": "the allowable internet media types (mime types) for the resume, e.g. word and pdf files",
          "items": {
            "$ref": "fileDownload.json#/definitions/mediaType"
          }
        }
      },
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "required": [
        "visible",
        "mandatory",
        "accept"
      ]
    },
    "vCardRule": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "someMandatory": {
          "description": "a simple way to hint that key vcard fields (first name, last name, email address) are mandatory - probably will get replaced by more fine-grained scheme in the future",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
"showPrefixField": {
	  "description": "a simple way to hint that key vcard title field should be displayed",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "allowedPrefixes": {
	  "type": "array",
          "description": "the allowable titles from the ATS. E.g.: [ Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr. ]",
	  "items": {
            "type": "string"
           }
        }        
      },
      "required": [
        "someMandatory", "showPrefixField"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    },
    "applicationModel": {
      "type": "object",
      "description": "rules specific to a single job application (i.e., not candidate-scoped)",
      "properties": {
        "job": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "the job application these rules apply to"
        },
        "itemsRule": {
          "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
        }
      },
      "additionalProperties": false
    },
    "candidateModel": {
      "type": "object",
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "requiredCategoryValues": {
            "$ref": "categoriesActual.json"
        },
        "resumeRule": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/resumeRule"
        },
        "vCardRule": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/vCardRule"
        },
        "itemsRule": {
          "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "resumeRule",
        "vCardRule"
      ]
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "tracker": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "just the same tracker that was passed in with the intent"
    },
    "candidateMessage": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/candidateMessage"
    },
    "candidateModel": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/candidateModel"
    },
    "applicationModel": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/applicationModel"
    }
  }
}

    Example:

    {
  "tracker": 763019932,
  "candidateMessage": {
    "message": "To apply, just complete this simple form. Best of luck!",
    "level": "info"
  },
  "candidateModel": {
    "vCardRule": {
      "someMandatory": true,
      "showPrefixField": false
    },
    "requiredCategoryValues": [
      {
        "category": 10032,
        "values": [
          3344
        ]
      },
      {
        "category": 10034,
        "values": [
          1001,
          1004
        ]
      }
    ],
    "resumeRule": {
      "visible": true,
      "mandatory": false,
      "accept": [
        "application/pdf",
        "application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document",
        "application/msword",
        "application/rtf",
        "text/plain"
      ],
      "message": "Providing a resume is great, but if you don't have one, just leave us a video recording instead"
    },
    "itemsRule": {
      "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/hyper-schema#",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "nursingCert": {
          "type": "object",
          "title": "C1 nursing certificate",
          "format": "tas-fileUpload",
          "access": "candidateOwned",
          "options": {
            "accept": "image/pdf"
          },
          "description": "Please scan and attach your C1 as pdf",
          "properties": {
            "data": {
              "type": "string",
              "media": {
                "binaryEncoding": "base64"
              }
            },
            "fileName": {
              "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        }
      },
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "applicationModel": {
    "job": 356347,
    "itemsRule": {
      "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/hyper-schema#",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "coverLetter": {
          "type": "object",
          "format": "tas-fileUpload",
          "access": "candidateOwned",
          "options": {
            "accept": "image/png,text/html"
          },
          "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",
          "properties": {
            "data": {
              "type": "string",
              "media": {
                "binaryEncoding": "base64"
              }
            },
            "fileName": {
              "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        },
        "favoriteColor": {
          "type": "string",
          "access": "eeo",
          "title": "Favorite color",
          "description": "Tell us your favorite color. Our advanced hiring algorithm uses it.",
          "default": "blue",
          "minLength": 1
        },
        "letters": {
          "type": "integer",
          "title": "Letters",
          "access": "eeo",
          "description": "How many letters are in this sentence?",
          "minimum": 0,
          "maximum": 20
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "favoriteColor",
        "letters"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  }
}

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /editSpecs/fetches/register/anonymous post

    post

    post /editSpecs/fetches/register/anonymous

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
    "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "tracker": {
            "type": "integer"
        },
        "categories": {
            "$ref": "categoriesActual.json"
        }
    },
    "additionalProperties": false
}

    Example:

    {
       "tracker": 763019932
}

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "candidateMessage": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "message": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "a text message to the candidate regarding their proposed edit, may include links"
        },
        "level": {
          "enum": [
            "info",
            "warning",
            "error"
          ]
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "message",
        "level"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    },
    "resumeRule": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "visible": {
          "description": "can a resume be uploaded at all, and can existing resume be seen",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "mandatory": {
          "description": "is the resume mandatory - implies visible == true",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "message": {
          "description": "a message to help the candidate understand about uploading a resume - e.g. 'resume optional when a video is provided'",
          "type": "string"
        },
        "accept": {
          "type": "array",
          "description": "the allowable internet media types (mime types) for the resume, e.g. word and pdf files",
          "items": {
            "$ref": "fileDownload.json#/definitions/mediaType"
          }
        }
      },
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "required": [
        "visible",
        "mandatory",
        "accept"
      ]
    },
    "vCardRule": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "someMandatory": {
          "description": "a simple way to hint that key vcard fields (first name, last name, email address) are mandatory - probably will get replaced by more fine-grained scheme in the future",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
"showPrefixField": {
	  "description": "a simple way to hint that key vcard title field should be displayed",
          "type": "boolean"
        },
        "allowedPrefixes": {
	  "type": "array",
          "description": "the allowable titles from the ATS. E.g.: [ Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr. ]",
	  "items": {
            "type": "string"
           }
        }        
      },
      "required": [
        "someMandatory", "showPrefixField"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    },
    "applicationModel": {
      "type": "object",
      "description": "rules specific to a single job application (i.e., not candidate-scoped)",
      "properties": {
        "job": {
          "type": "integer",
          "description": "the job application these rules apply to"
        },
        "itemsRule": {
          "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
        }
      },
      "additionalProperties": false
    },
    "candidateModel": {
      "type": "object",
      "additionalProperties": false,
      "properties": {
        "requiredCategoryValues": {
            "$ref": "categoriesActual.json"
        },
        "resumeRule": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/resumeRule"
        },
        "vCardRule": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/vCardRule"
        },
        "itemsRule": {
          "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "resumeRule",
        "vCardRule"
      ]
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "additionalProperties": false,
  "properties": {
    "tracker": {
      "type": "integer",
      "description": "just the same tracker that was passed in with the intent"
    },
    "candidateMessage": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/candidateMessage"
    },
    "candidateModel": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/candidateModel"
    },
    "applicationModel": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/applicationModel"
    }
  }
}

    Example:

    {
  "tracker": 763019932,
  "candidateMessage": {
    "message": "To apply, just complete this simple form. Best of luck!",
    "level": "info"
  },
  "candidateModel": {
    "vCardRule": {
      "someMandatory": true,
      "showPrefixField": false
    },
    "requiredCategoryValues": [
      {
        "category": 10032,
        "values": [
          3344
        ]
      },
      {
        "category": 10034,
        "values": [
          1001,
          1004
        ]
      }
    ],
    "resumeRule": {
      "visible": true,
      "mandatory": false,
      "accept": [
        "application/pdf",
        "application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document",
        "application/msword",
        "application/rtf",
        "text/plain"
      ],
      "message": "Providing a resume is great, but if you don't have one, just leave us a video recording instead"
    },
    "itemsRule": {
      "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/hyper-schema#",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "nursingCert": {
          "type": "object",
          "title": "C1 nursing certificate",
          "format": "tas-fileUpload",
          "access": "candidateOwned",
          "options": {
            "accept": "image/pdf"
          },
          "description": "Please scan and attach your C1 as pdf",
          "properties": {
            "data": {
              "type": "string",
              "media": {
                "binaryEncoding": "base64"
              }
            },
            "fileName": {
              "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        }
      },
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "applicationModel": {
    "job": 356347,
    "itemsRule": {
      "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/hyper-schema#",
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "coverLetter": {
          "type": "object",
          "format": "tas-fileUpload",
          "access": "candidateOwned",
          "options": {
            "accept": "image/png,text/html"
          },
          "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",
          "properties": {
            "data": {
              "type": "string",
              "media": {
                "binaryEncoding": "base64"
              }
            },
            "fileName": {
              "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        },
        "favoriteColor": {
          "type": "string",
          "access": "eeo",
          "title": "Favorite color",
          "description": "Tell us your favorite color. Our advanced hiring algorithm uses it.",
          "default": "blue",
          "minLength": 1
        },
        "letters": {
          "type": "integer",
          "title": "Letters",
          "access": "eeo",
          "description": "How many letters are in this sentence?",
          "minimum": 0,
          "maximum": 20
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "favoriteColor",
        "letters"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  }
}

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /global

    resources which are global/singletons

    /global/internalIPMatches/byIP/{ip} get

    get

    Return true if the IP passed in falls within one of the ranges known to be internal. Apps can use this to make educated guesses about whether to display, for example, buttons like "employee referral" on jobs, depending on whether the user is on the internal network/VPN. Note apps should use this only as an indication, and should require the candidate to actually log in and thus be proven an internal before unlocking any actual internal behaviour (e.g. allowing the referral to be made).

    get /global/internalIPMatches/byIP/{ip}

    Return true if the IP passed in falls within one of the ranges known to be internal. Apps can use this to make educated guesses about whether to display, for example, buttons like "employee referral" on jobs, depending on whether the user is on the internal network/VPN. Note apps should use this only as an indication, and should require the candidate to actually log in and thus be proven an internal before unlocking any actual internal behaviour (e.g. allowing the referral to be made).

    • Request
    • Response

    URI Parameters

    • ip: required (string)

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: text/plain

    /global/jqueryInclude get

    get

    Get a fragment of HTML with a script tag that pulls in the "current" jquery library, so that it is available to any javascript running anywhere in the page. Any page that injects (other than via iframe) HTML from other apps must include this, so that the injected apps can use it. When, from time to time, the jquery version is updated, all apps therefore receive the update at once.

    get /global/jqueryInclude

    Get a fragment of HTML with a script tag that pulls in the "current" jquery library, so that it is available to any javascript running anywhere in the page. Any page that injects (other than via iframe) HTML from other apps must include this, so that the injected apps can use it. When, from time to time, the jquery version is updated, all apps therefore receive the update at once.

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: text/html

    Example:

    <script src="//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.8.1/jquery.min.js"></script>

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /global/candidateTAndCs get

    get

    Get the url of the terms and conditions that a candidate must accept before creating an account. Any apps that allow candidates to create accounts (such as apply apps) must require the candidate to agree to these.

    get /global/candidateTAndCs

    Get the url of the terms and conditions that a candidate must accept before creating an account. Any apps that allow candidates to create accounts (such as apply apps) must require the candidate to agree to these.

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: text/plain

    Example:

    https://example.com/candidate/termsAndConditions.html

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items

    /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job} get

    items held on a job that are visible to candidates, e.g. position description document

    get

    Get values and (in some scenarios) metadata, for all items

    get /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job}

    Get values and (in some scenarios) metadata, for all items

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • job: required (string)

    Query Parameters

    • embedMeta: (boolean)

      Pass true to have schema fragments embedded in the response when fetching items. Less network trips, larger overall message. Defaults to false.

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
	"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
	"type":"array",
	"items":{ "$ref": "item.json" }
}

    Example:

    [
  {
    "name": "selfScore",
    "value": {
      "raw": {
        "Travel OK": "Yes"
      },
      "display": "Travel:Y"
    }
  },
  {
    "name": "coverLetter",
    "value": {
      "raw": {
        "data": "iu7g6xswqs6216Ug564fojho7if8dfi876GKJH..",
        "fileName": "coverletter.docx",
        "via": "dropbox.com",
        "burnerUri": "https://acme.superats.com/burnerlinks/uygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI"
      },
      "display": "%3Ca%20href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Facme.superats.com%2Fburnerlinks%2FuygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI%22%3Ecoverletter.docx%3C%2Fa%3E"
    }
  }
]

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job}/byName/{item} get

    get

    Get value and (in some scenarios), metadata for a specific item

    get /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job}/byName/{item}

    Get value and (in some scenarios), metadata for a specific item

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • job: required (string)
    • item: required (string)

    Query Parameters

    • embedMeta: (boolean)

      Pass true to have schema fragments embedded in the response when fetching items. Less network trips, larger overall message. Defaults to false.

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "raw": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "type": "object",
          "additionalProperties": true,
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as an object"
        },
        {
          "type": "boolean",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a boolean"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a string"
        },
        {
          "type": "number",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a number"
        }
      ]
    },
    "display": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "the value rendered as an HTML fragment, e.g. suitable for embedding in a table cell, encoded using erl encoding"
    },
    "value": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "raw": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/raw"
        },
        "display": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/display"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "raw",
        "display"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "name of the item"
    },
    "meta": {
      "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
    },
    "value": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/value"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": false
}

    Example:

    {
  "name": "cover letter",
  "value": {
    "raw": {
      "data": "iu7g6xswqs6216Ug564fojho7if8dfi876GKJH..",
      "fileName": "coverletter.docx",
      "via": "dropbox.com",
      "burnerUri": "https://acme.superats.com/burnerlinks/uygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI"
    },
    "display": "%3Ca%20href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Facme.superats.com%2Fburnerlinks%2FuygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI%22%3Ecoverletter.docx%3C%2Fa%3E"
  }
}

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job}/itemMetas get

    Metadata for candidate-scoped items visible to the candidate - includes candidateOwned, internalShared and eeo (not internalOwned)

    get

    Get metadata for all items

    get /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job}/itemMetas

    Get metadata for all items

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • job: required (string)

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
	"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
	"type":"array",
	"items":{ "$ref": "item.json" }
}

    Example:

    [
   {
      "name": "cover letter",
      "meta": {
         "type": "object",
         "title": "Cover letter",
         "format": "tas-fileUpload",
         "access": "candidateOwned",
         "options": {
            "accept": "image/png,text/html"
         },
         "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",
         "properties": {
            "data": {
               "type": "string",
               "media": {
                  "binaryEncoding": "base64"
               }
            },
            "fileName": {
               "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
               "type": "string"
            }
         }
      }
   },
   {
      "name": "favorite color",
      "meta": {
         "enum": [
            "Red",
            "Green"
         ]
      }
   }
]

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job}/itemMetas/byName/{item} get

    get

    Get metadata for a specific item

    get /items/toCandidate/anonymous/jobs/{job}/itemMetas/byName/{item}

    Get metadata for a specific item

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • job: required (string)
    • item: required (string)

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "raw": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "type": "object",
          "additionalProperties": true,
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as an object"
        },
        {
          "type": "boolean",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a boolean"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a string"
        },
        {
          "type": "number",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a number"
        }
      ]
    },
    "display": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "the value rendered as an HTML fragment, e.g. suitable for embedding in a table cell, encoded using erl encoding"
    },
    "value": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "raw": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/raw"
        },
        "display": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/display"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "raw",
        "display"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "name of the item"
    },
    "meta": {
      "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
    },
    "value": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/value"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": false
}

    Example:

    {
  "name": "cover letter",
  "meta": {
    "type": "object",
    "title": "Cover letter",
    "format": "tas-fileUpload",
    "access": "candidateOwned",
    "options": {
      "accept": "image/png,text/html"
    },
    "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",
    "properties": {
      "data": {
        "type": "string",
        "media": {
          "binaryEncoding": "base64"
        }
      },
      "fileName": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "via": {
        "type": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items/toCandidate/me get

    candidate-visible items held on the candidate themselves, e.g. their own answers when applying for jobs

    get

    Get values and (in some scenarios) metadata, for all items

    get /items/toCandidate/me

    Get values and (in some scenarios) metadata, for all items

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • embedMeta: (boolean)

      Pass true to have schema fragments embedded in the response when fetching items. Less network trips, larger overall message. Defaults to false.

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
	"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
	"type":"array",
	"items":{ "$ref": "item.json" }
}

    Example:

    [
  {
    "name": "selfScore",
    "value": {
      "raw": {
        "Travel OK": "Yes"
      },
      "display": "Travel:Y"
    }
  },
  {
    "name": "coverLetter",
    "value": {
      "raw": {
        "data": "iu7g6xswqs6216Ug564fojho7if8dfi876GKJH..",
        "fileName": "coverletter.docx",
        "via": "dropbox.com",
        "burnerUri": "https://acme.superats.com/burnerlinks/uygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI"
      },
      "display": "%3Ca%20href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Facme.superats.com%2Fburnerlinks%2FuygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI%22%3Ecoverletter.docx%3C%2Fa%3E"
    }
  }
]

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items/toCandidate/me/byName/{item} get

    get

    Get value and (in some scenarios), metadata for a specific item

    get /items/toCandidate/me/byName/{item}

    Get value and (in some scenarios), metadata for a specific item

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • item: required (string)

    Query Parameters

    • embedMeta: (boolean)

      Pass true to have schema fragments embedded in the response when fetching items. Less network trips, larger overall message. Defaults to false.

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "raw": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "type": "object",
          "additionalProperties": true,
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as an object"
        },
        {
          "type": "boolean",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a boolean"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a string"
        },
        {
          "type": "number",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a number"
        }
      ]
    },
    "display": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "the value rendered as an HTML fragment, e.g. suitable for embedding in a table cell, encoded using erl encoding"
    },
    "value": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "raw": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/raw"
        },
        "display": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/display"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "raw",
        "display"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "name of the item"
    },
    "meta": {
      "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
    },
    "value": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/value"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": false
}

    Example:

    {
  "name": "cover letter",
  "value": {
    "raw": {
      "data": "iu7g6xswqs6216Ug564fojho7if8dfi876GKJH..",
      "fileName": "coverletter.docx",
      "via": "dropbox.com",
      "burnerUri": "https://acme.superats.com/burnerlinks/uygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI"
    },
    "display": "%3Ca%20href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Facme.superats.com%2Fburnerlinks%2FuygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI%22%3Ecoverletter.docx%3C%2Fa%3E"
  }
}

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items/toCandidate/me/itemMetas get

    Metadata for candidate-scoped items visible to the candidate - includes candidateOwned, internalShared and eeo (not internalOwned)

    get

    Get metadata for all items

    get /items/toCandidate/me/itemMetas

    Get metadata for all items

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
	"$schema":"http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
	"type":"array",
	"items":{ "$ref": "item.json" }
}

    Example:

    [
   {
      "name": "cover letter",
      "meta": {
         "type": "object",
         "title": "Cover letter",
         "format": "tas-fileUpload",
         "access": "candidateOwned",
         "options": {
            "accept": "image/png,text/html"
         },
         "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",
         "properties": {
            "data": {
               "type": "string",
               "media": {
                  "binaryEncoding": "base64"
               }
            },
            "fileName": {
               "type": "string"
            },
            "via": {
               "type": "string"
            }
         }
      }
   },
   {
      "name": "favorite color",
      "meta": {
         "enum": [
            "Red",
            "Green"
         ]
      }
   }
]

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    /items/toCandidate/me/itemMetas/byName/{item} get

    get

    Get metadata for a specific item

    get /items/toCandidate/me/itemMetas/byName/{item}

    Get metadata for a specific item

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • item: required (string)

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "raw": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "type": "object",
          "additionalProperties": true,
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as an object"
        },
        {
          "type": "boolean",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a boolean"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a string"
        },
        {
          "type": "number",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a number"
        }
      ]
    },
    "display": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "the value rendered as an HTML fragment, e.g. suitable for embedding in a table cell, encoded using erl encoding"
    },
    "value": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "raw": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/raw"
        },
        "display": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/display"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "raw",
        "display"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "name of the item"
    },
    "meta": {
      "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
    },
    "value": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/value"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": false
}

    Example:

    {
  "name": "cover letter",
  "meta": {
    "type": "object",
    "title": "Cover letter",
    "format": "tas-fileUpload",
    "access": "candidateOwned",
    "options": {
      "accept": "image/png,text/html"
    },
    "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",
    "properties": {
      "data": {
        "type": "string",
        "media": {
          "binaryEncoding": "base64"
        }
      },
      "fileName": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "via": {
        "type": "string"
      }
    }
  }
}

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    Headers

    • Authorization: (string)

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    HTTP status code 401

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

        "burnerUri": "https://acme.superats.com/burnerlinks/uygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI"

    /items/toCandidate/me/forJob/{job}/byName/{item} get

    get

    Get value and (in some scenarios), metadata for a specific item

    get /items/toCandidate/me/forJob/{job}/byName/{item}

    Get value and (in some scenarios), metadata for a specific item

    Secured by oauth_2_0

    OAuth is used to authenticate tenant API calls. Tenant API calls may be on behalf of a specific principal (e.g. user)

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • job: required (string)
    • item: required (string)

    Query Parameters

    • embedMeta: (boolean)

      Pass true to have schema fragments embedded in the response when fetching items. Less network trips, larger overall message. Defaults to false.

    HTTP status code 200

    Body

    Type: application/json

    Schema:

    {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
  "definitions": {
    "raw": {
      "oneOf": [
        {
          "type": "object",
          "additionalProperties": true,
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as an object"
        },
        {
          "type": "boolean",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a boolean"
        },
        {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a string"
        },
        {
          "type": "number",
          "description": "json representation of the item's current value as a number"
        }
      ]
    },
    "display": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "the value rendered as an HTML fragment, e.g. suitable for embedding in a table cell, encoded using erl encoding"
    },
    "value": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "raw": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/raw"
        },
        "display": {
          "$ref": "#/definitions/display"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "raw",
        "display"
      ],
      "additionalProperties": false
    }
  },
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "name": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "name of the item"
    },
    "meta": {
      "$ref": "jsonSchemaSchema.json"
    },
    "value": {
      "$ref": "#/definitions/value"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "name"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": false
}

    Example:

    {
  "name": "cover letter",
  "value": {
    "raw": {
      "data": "iu7g6xswqs6216Ug564fojho7if8dfi876GKJH..",
      "fileName": "coverletter.docx",
      "via": "dropbox.com",
      "burnerUri": "https://acme.superats.com/burnerlinks/uygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI"
    },
    "display": "%3Ca%20href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Facme.superats.com%2Fburnerlinks%2FuygUy35WEsw2rdcrewd45FtIEsw2rdcrewd45FtI%22%3Ecoverletter.docx%3C%2Fa%3E"
  }
}

    Headers

      Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

    Bad or expired token. To fix, you should re-authenticate the user.

    HTTP status code 403

    Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

    Body

    Type: application/json

  "additionalProperties": false

    "format": "tas-fileUpload",

    "options": {
      "accept": "image/png,text/html"
    },
    "description": "Please upload a cover letter. The shorter the better",

        "media": {

        }
      },
      "fileName": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "via": {
        "type": "string"
      }
    }
  }
